newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Fischler says farmers must join forces with food industry.
newsitem.headline: Fischler says farmers must join forces with food industry.

text.p: A strong partnership between European Union farmers and the food processing industry was needed to enable the EU to compete in an expanding world market, EU Farm Commissioner Franz Fischler said on Friday.

"Assuring the smooth collaboration between farmers and the food industry...is essential if Europe wants to retain her position as the world's leading trade partner in agriculture," Fischler said in a speech in The Hague, a copy of which was released in Brussels.

Speaking to the Commodity Boards for Arable Products, Fischler said that farmers sometimes overlooked the important role the industry plays in making the raw products attractive to consumers through refining, innovating and raising quality.
The EU food industry, which was given a great boost by the creation of a single EU market in 1993, recorded a turnover of 450 billion Ecus in 1994 and employed 2.5 million people.
